general.headline: Expert in Finance, M&A and Private Equity I Partner at Minter Ellison
general.description:
What originally appealed to me about corporate and acquisition finance was that each business being financed or acquired was different from the last. That still holds true today, where one week I might be involved in the takeover of a childcare or retail group and the next week it might be the financing of a healthcare or IT business. This provides exposure to many interesting industries not to mention a wide range of people. I also like working with other people and this industry demands that you do.

Every lawyer brings to the table their own style. Mine is collaborative, to focus on the issues that make a difference and to never lose sight of our client's commercial interest. After joining Minters in Melbourne in 1996 I did a 3 year stint with Hogan Lovells in London, rejoining Minters in 2002, partner in 2005.  In that time I've worked on some exciting and complex transactions across a broad range of industries. I was lucky enough to be seconded to Croatia for a few months in 2000 where I assisted putting together a guide on how to do business in that country.

Recent transactions in the M&A space: amaysim's acquisition of Click Energy, FOXTEL's acquisition of Austar, TPG's acquisition of Pipe Networks, Vocus' acquisition of Amcom and Tronox's acquisition of Exxaro.  Private equity transactions: Anchorage Capital Partners of Affinity Education and Quadrant Private Equity of ICON Cancer Care and Fitness Lifestyle Group. Corporate financings: InfoTrack and the share registry business Link Group.

Outside of work I'm kept active with 4 children and interests ranging from bushwalking, soccer and swimming to restaurants, social and wine.

general.headline: Special Counsel, Tax at Minter Ellison
general.description:
Rimma is a Special Counsel with Minter Ellison Tax team specialising in Tax Controversy and has a proven track record of facilitating resolution of taxation disputes and of conducting tax litigation. Rimma has experience in representing either side to the dispute: the private clients and the Australian Taxation Office (ATO), resulting in a well-balanced approach to the disputes and understanding of the issues arising in tax controversy, including a great understanding of the preventative measures that should be considered and implemented by clients in order as to avoid further disputes. Rimma uses her unique insight to assist her clients to achieve best possible outcome.

Rimma is an integral part of the Tax Controversy team, well known for providing objective advice and assessment on the most relevant and efficient way to resolve or manage any controversy with the ATO. We have an excellent track record in the early resolution of major risk reviews and audits with the ATO. Our tax practitioners have unrivaled depth of experience and knowledge of the entire spectrum of tax controversy processes. This is supplemented by many years as tax litigators both for and against the ATO.

general.headline: Principal Legal Consultant, GAICD
general.description:
I am a corporate finance lawyer with over 15 years鈥� experience working with corporates, funds and banks in Australia and the United Kingdom.  I founded Aurora In-house Legal (Aurora) to offer legal consulting services to boards and management teams to execute strategic projects and major corporate and financing transactions on a contracting basis.

I am a trusted advisor who is well-regarded in providing my clients a balanced and pragmatic approach to resolving legal, contractual and operational issues.  With my strong technical legal skills gained from top tier private practice and a deep understanding of risks and commercial drivers of businesses gained as deputy general counsel, I am passionate about delivering results to achieve strategic organisation goals.

I am experienced in working with a diverse range of internal stakeholders including boards, executives and leadership teams.  I also work as an effective conduit with all external parties (including external lawyers, investment banks and financial and tax advisors) and my unique experience and insight on the conduct of matters allows me to run them smoothly whilst managing risks.

I have successfully executed large transactions and major projects in debt financing, corporate bonds issues, corporate debt restructures, business acquisitions and sales, business reorganisations, regulatory change implementation, new product initiatives and precedent rewrite projects from a legal perspective in Australia, the UK and the US.

Prior to Aurora, I was deputy general counsel at GE Capital and led a high performing legal team that advised GE Capital's commercial lending business in Australia.  Following the announcement of GE's global sale of all its financial assets, I was retained by the company to execute the sale of its Australian business and subsequent wind-down and closure in Australia.

I am a qualified lawyer in New South Wales, Australia and England & Wales.

general.headline: Head of ANZ Health, Corporate & Institutional at ANZ
general.description:
The Head of ANZ Health spanning the Corporate & Institutional sectors, Sam is responsible for the growth and profitability of ANZ's national Health business. 

The ANZ Health business includes clients in sub-segments covering retirement living, aged care, hospitals, diagnostic imaging, childcare, community care, pharmaceutical, allied health and health property.  

Sam is responsible for leading and developing a team of Directors, Relationship Managers and Relationship Credit Managers in a large and active industry segment. The role requires delivery of the strategic sales agenda which focuses on tailored, profitable solutions while also maintaining sound credit standards. 
 
This leadership role also includes responsibility for maintaining ANZs external profile in the Health industry, working with senior risk colleagues to monitor risk appetite, make investment decisions and coordinate health sector product strategies. 

Prior to joining ANZ鈥檚 Health team, Sam was an Executive Director in ANZ's Leveraged and Acquisition Finance team, with 10 years experience in originating and leading event driven debt financings. His experience specifically included debt financings for mergers and acquisitions, public to privates, public to public's, IPO's and return of capital to shareholders, predominantly for Australasian and Global Private Equity firms and corporate clients. 

Prior to that Sam was a founding member of ANZ's Client Insights Team and part of ANZ鈥檚 Graduate Program in the Institutional Relationships team covering Consumer and Agribusiness clients.

Grant is widely recognised as one of Australia's leading private equity lawyers, including by Chambers Asia-Pacific (2012, 2013, 2014, 2015, 2016) which notes Grant "is known as a particularly thorough practitioner鈥�.characterised by clients as a tough negotiator who gets to know their businesses well and delivers appropriately focused and commercial advice", and by Best Lawyer's International (2013, 2014, 2015, 2016) where he is ranked as a Leading Lawyer in five categories (Mergers & Acquisitions Law, Corporate Law, Private Equity, Venture Capital Law and Leveraged Buyouts).  In 2015 Grant was awarded Best Lawyers' Australian Venture Capital Lawyer of the Year.

In 2016, Grant was a Finalist in 鈥淎ustralian Dealmaker of the Year鈥� at the Australasian Law Awards.

Grant is qualified in both Australia and the UK and worked in London for a number of years before relocating to Sydney.

general.headline: Co-founder / Director Criniti's
general.description:
Criniti's is well and truly Sydney's iconic Italian hot spot.

Criniti's was originally founded in 2003 in Parramatta, in Sydney's west by an inspired husband and wife team. They were driven by a passion for fine quality food and cultivated success.

Their yearning and hard driven aspirations developed dramatically over the years, which resulted in a popular spot amongst the locals. It didn't take long for the news to spread south, east and north of the border. Patrons travelled from all parts of Sydney to see what all "the fuss" was about.

After much success and rave reviews Criniti's decided it was time to spread its wings east of the border. In August of 2009 it opened their doors in Sydney's east with an immaculate location in the world famous Harbourside Shopping Centre, fast becoming the pinnacle restaurant of Sydney's famous Darling Harbour.With breath taking views and ample open air terrace seating this location will please the most discerning of local and international.

In 2011, due to an overwhelming demand, Criniti's opened its doors in the Hills district of Sydney. Located in the famous Piazza in Castle Towers, the Matthew Darwin designed space includes spacious dining area for 350+ customers spread over 2 levels with a sophisticated mix of banquets and chairs to complement the rustic decor.

Manly, Woolloomooloo, Carlton and Kotara , Southbank have opened there doors since.

First Home Buyers

jobs.description:
Viva Energy Australia is the exclusive licensee of Shell products in Australia and the producer of Shell fuels, lubricants, chemicals, marine products and bitumen. 

In this role, I provide strategic advice to the Chief Financial Officer (CFO) in support of leadership development, engagement, culture and organisational design.  

Key Achievements

Successfully drove and implemented a massive transformational change agenda during a significant period of uncertainty, including a change of business ownership, new senior leaders and constantly changing priorities.  This was accomplished by working in partnership with the CFO and Chief Information Officer (CIO) to restructure Corporate Function鈥檚 to support a local business.  Key changes included; on shoring and subsequent offshoring of month end financial activities and on shoring approximately 150+ IT applications previously supported by Shell Global.

Made a significant contribution to creating a stronger performance culture through substantially improving leadership capability in managing employee performance. Coached leaders to manage and resolve a multitude of complex and sensitive performance issues ranging from serious and wilful misconduct, misconduct and performance improvement processes.  Designed a Company-wide leadership development in performance management and developed sustainable yet practical tools for leaders to use ongoing.

Significantly improved employee engagement within Corporate Functions by working in collaboration with the senior leadership team to develop strategies and initiatives to address key engagement drivers that required substantial improvement.

On 14 August 2014, the Shell Company of Australia Pty Ltd changed its name to Viva
      Energy Australia Pty Ltd following the divestment of the Shell Australia downstream
      
      business to global oil trader Vitol and multiple private investors.

ZIP Airport Services Pty Ltd is a wholly owned subsidiary of Shell Australia Limited and provides aircraft refuelling services to major and regional airports across Australia.
							
In this role, I established and managed the Human Resources and Payroll functions that supported four major and three regional Australian Airports.  

Key Achievements

Successfully negotiated eight Enterprise Agreements with no industrial disputation and in accordance with mandate. This was achieved by providing HR leadership and expertise in industrial negotiations, industrial relations processes, the Fair Work Act and the making of Enterprise Agreements.

Effectively lead a project team to significantly improve the accuracy and efficiency of the Company payroll system through the seamless upgrade of payroll software and implementation of a biometric timekeeping system.  These improvements resulted in employees being paid in accordance with Enterprise Agreements, accurate leave accruals, reliable financial data, meaningful reporting and robust financial controls. 

Substantially improved the leadership capability of Airport Managers and Supervisors in the area of performance management. This was accomplished by designing and delivering a fit for purpose Coaching, Counselling and Discipline program and providing regular coaching to up skill leaders to counsel and discipline employees, investigate safety breaches and manage a range of employee performance management issues.

Instrumental in managing the seamless transition of a Shell Distributor鈥檚 employees to a third party contractor and then to ZIP. Undertook detailed analysis of current state, identified and worked to resolve complex HR and legal issues, highlighted risks and implemented practical strategies to achieve a seamless change including the negotiation of a new Enterprise Agreement.

GM Holden is a wholly owned subsidiary of the General Motors Corporation.  This iconic Australian company designs and manufactures passenger vehicles for local and export markets.

In this role, I provided operational and strategic HR advice to Engineering, Program Management, Strategy and Planning in support of organisational design and restructuring, employee engagement and performance management. 

Key Achievements
Restructured multiple corporate functions to support future business requirements with minimal disruption to the business. This was achieved by providing HR leadership and expertise to GM Holden Board members in organisational change, organisational design and employee engagement.

Significantly improved leadership capability across client groups by designing and delivering leadership development programs and coaching individual leaders in the areas of performance management, candid and constructive feedback and organisational change.

Lead a team of six HR professionals to deliver high quality, cost effective training and development programs and managed the competency based progression structures for GM Holden鈥檚 Victorian Operations.

Key Achievements
Lead a major organisational change project involving stakeholders from multiple business units to implement a competency based assessment model for trade employees.  This resulted in robust assessments for pay progression and an increased focus on skill based training.  In 2008, the competency based model was awarded the Automotive Training Strategy 鈥� Large Business Category by Automotive Training Australia.

Significantly improved Line Manager and Supervisor capability across multiple business units through one on one coaching and designing and delivering leadership development programs including performance management and attendance management.

Coached and developed a disparate team to become high performing HR professionals to provide Employee Development support and expertise across the Victorian Operations.  This included up skilling team members in instructional design to enable them to develop fit for purpose training material for manufacturing and engineering.

During my time with GM Holden, I held multiple local and regional generalist HR roles.  
I also undertook a number of Industrial Relations positions which involved negotiating Enterprise Agreements and appearing before the Fair Work Commission.

general.headline: Senior Associate, King & Wood Mallesons
general.description:
Edwina is a lawyer specialising in China related cross-border disputes and represents clients in international arbitrations, intellectual property disputes and commercial litigation. Currently based in Sydney, she has also practiced in Beijing, Hong Kong and Perth.  

Edwina has been recognised in the 2019, 2018 and 2017 Who's Who Legal as "Future Leader" in International Arbitration.  

Edwina was also one of 25 young leaders chosen for the Cultural Diversity and Leadership Fellowship program at University of Sydney Business School & the Australian Human Rights Commission in 2018.  

Edwina's expertise involves all forms of dispute resolution, commercial strategy & negotiations. Edwina advises clients on shareholder, JV and IP disputes in the retail, e-commerce, private equity, construction, energy & resources and international trade sectors. She also advises on commercial IP issues including market entry, brand protection & enforcement. 

Edwina has acted in arbitrations in a number of jurisdictions under various arbitration rules, as well as in investor-state treaty claims.  She also represents clients in the Australian and Hong Kong courts. 

Edwina represented the Noongar people in a landmark native title case in Western Australia and has acted as advisor to the Commonwealth Attorney-General's Department on national security, including the status of Australian detainees in Guantanamo Bay.  Edwina has also acted as a pro bono legal advisor to asylum seekers detained on Christmas Island. 

Edwina co-founded the China Young Arbitration Group in Beijing, has lectured at Tsinghua University Master of Laws Program in International Arbitration & Dispute Settlement and the University of NSW and Chartered Institute of Arbitrators Diploma in International Arbitration. Edwina regularly speaks at conferences and seminars on international dispute resolution. 

Edwina is admitted in New South Wales, Hong Kong and the High Court of Australia. She speaks English and Mandarin.

general.headline: Partner, Ashurst
general.description:
Stuart is a Partner in the Corporate Transactions team in Ashurst's Sydney office. 

Stuart specialises in mergers and acquisitions, private equity, venture capital investments and fund raising for early stage companies.  Stuart advises on takeovers and schemes of arrangements, fund raising, shareholder arrangements, management incentive plans and Initial Public Offers.  

In 2011 Stuart was seconded to the Takeovers Panel and acted as an adviser on commercial and legal issues, worked on takeovers policy and assisted in the management of applications before the Panel.  Stuart has since acted on a number of contentious matters before the Panel.

From 2013 to 2015 Stuart practiced in Ashurst's London office and worked on a variety of mergers and acquisitions and equity capital markets transactions.  During his time in London, Stuart was seconded to the investment banking team at N M Rothschild & Sons and worked in the M&A and ECM specialist advisory division.

jobs.description:
Stuart is a partner in the Corporate Transactions team in Sydney who specialises in mergers & acquisitions and equity capital market transactions. Stuart's experience includes off-market takeover bids, schemes of arrangements, Takeover Panel proceedings, Initial Public Offers and secondary market capital raisings.

Stuart has worked on some of Australia's largest and most complex corporate transactions, drawing on his experience working at the Takeovers Panel and in the investment banking team at N M Rothschild & Sons in London. Stuart was part of the team advising the consortium comprising KKR, V盲rde and Deutsche Bank on the $9.4 billion acquisition of the GE's consumer finance business and Lihir Gold on its $9.5 billion merger with Newcrest Mining Limited.

Stuart also has experience on a range of corporate and commercial matters including, shareholder / consortium agreements, management equity plans and advising on the ASX Listing Rules, insider trading and foreign investment law and policy.

Rothschild is a global financial advisory group with offices through the UK, Continental Europe, China, Brazil, India, the United States of America, the Middle East and Asia Pacific.

The London Global Financial Advisory (investment banking) team is the largest team of advisory bankers in the UK, where Rothschild has consistently advised on more UK M&A deals than any other adviser. 

Stuart was a secondee in the Global Financial Advisory  team in the London office. Stuart was a member of the Specialist Advisory Team which advises on a range of public takeovers, capital market transactions and provides strategic advice to the Global Financial Advisory team.

The Australian Takeovers Panel is the primary forum for resolving disputes about takeover bids until the bid period has ended. The Panel is a peer review body, with part time members appointed from the active members of Australia's takeovers and business communities. The Panel seeks to decide disputes in a speedy manner by focusing primarily on commercial and policy issues.

In 2011, Stuart was seconded to the Australian Takeovers Panel where he acted as an adviser to the Panel on commercial and legal issues, worked on takeovers policy and assisted in the management of applications before the Panel.

The Executive Council is responsible for the management and implementation of Young Lawyers projects, activities and to assist in the planning of the Continuing Legal Education program.

The Business Law Committee is a forum of like-minded individuals who have joined together to improve their own knowledge of business law and foster increased understanding of this area and  review and comment on legal developments across corporate and commercial law, banking and finance, superannuation, taxation, insolvency, competition and trade practices.

Macquarie Group Limited is a global investment banking and diversified financial services group, providing banking, financial, advisory, investment and funds management services to institutional, corporate and retail clients and counterparties around the world. Headquartered in Sydney, Macquarie is the largest investment bank and the top ranked mergers and acquisitions advisor in Australia.

In 2005/2006 Stuart worked as a summer intern as an analyst for the ASX-listed Macquarie Communications Infrastructure Group within the Infrastructure and Specialised Funds team within the Investment Banking Division.

jobs.description:
I am an Associate in the road accident injuries department of Maurice Blackburn, based in Reservoir. I help people with their TAC compensation claims.

I was admitted to practice in 2004 and hold a Bachelor of Arts (Honours in Criminology & Advanced Modern Greek) and Bachelor of Laws, with a Masters in Law.

As a law student, I took a particular interest in litigation and advocacy and pursued a career in personal injury law.  I have practiced exclusively in transport accident matters for over nine years and have fought for the entitlements of clients and their families against the TAC, and to achieve the best possible outcome in a timely manner.

I feel much satisfaction in being able to communicate complex areas of law in a clear and concise manner, so everyday Australians can gain an understanding of their rights and entitlements.  I follow a claim the whole way through, to allow my clients the opportunity to focus on their recovery while knowing their legal issues are in good hands.

I have knowledge and experience in all aspects of the TAC scheme, including but not limited to, claims for medical benefits and income support, lump sum compensation be it impairment benefits or common law damages. I have had considerable exposure to court litigation in all jurisdictions and I have developed an ability to thoroughly prepare and analyse the claims of my clients to obtain the best possible outcome.

I am also a member of the Australian Plaintiff Lawyers Association and the Law Institute of Victoria. I speaks fluent Greek and am actively involved in the Greek community.

general.headline: National Legal Counsel at Electrical Trades Union of Australia
general.description:
Alana Heffernan is the National Legal Counsel of the Electrical Trades Union of Australia.

Alana represents union members and officials in relation to a broad range of industrial and employment issues including dismissals, discrimination, disputes, adverse action complaints, workplace investigations, disciplinary proceedings and contract issues. She is experienced in appearing before the relevant courts and tribunals, as well as negotiating out of court settlements.

Alana has a particular interest in anti-discrimination law and has actively advocated for amendments to anti-discrimination law to include protections for victims of domestic violence. These proposed amendments have been supported and advocated for by various community and legal peak bodies, as well as the Australian Council of Human Rights Agencies.

Alana is an experienced advocate and her history in employment relations is diverse, having worked in private practice, for trade unions and for community organisations.

In addition to her work at the ETU, Alana is a member of numerous professional associations, such as the Sydney Gay and Lesbian Business Association and the Industrial Relations Society of NSW.

general.description:
Involved in Quality Management & improvement in Manufacturing & Services, tertiary teaching and consulting and training. This has included senior roles for an automotive supplier and in the service sector and lecturing at three Universities.  

My passion is coaching others to success - either project work, using data to make clever management decisions and personal development. Now on the MBA Advisory Board for LaTrobe University, focus being to align education with practitioner competencies.

My LSS experience has been gained through projects, deployment experience and academic research. Projects have been across all industry sectors together with the delivery of LSS training programs. Recently have been educating a company in data and predictive analysis and the importance of smart management decision for innovation and improvement.

Recently, had the privilege to be a chapter writer of a book on Leadership - Engaged Leadership
Transforming through Future-Oriented Design Thinking https://www.springer.com/gp/book/9783319722207 

My academic research has been across all industry sectors to develop a model for sustainable deployment of Continuous Improvement. My personal passion is in developing the interpersonal and mindfulness skills of others during the management of change. I have a doctorate in business administration, the thesis and published work focusing on competencies required in sustainable continuous improvement. 

Adopting standardization of competencies in CI is critical to successful deployment and one of our platforms to ensure this is met with the new International Standard for Lean & Six Sigma, namely  ISO18404.

Creating a culture of continuous improvement is our focus and a necessary condition for this is for everyone to understand more about their subconscious behaviors and patterns. The combination of quality improvement and emotional intelligence will lead to effective change as there will less impact from the subconscious.

Nevertheless, I ran it successfully until many other mad things, I was doing at the time, collapsed and forced me to sell it. I eventually got a job at Dulux in December 1996 and I made my way back out of the crisis to a management position in Manufacturing at Dulux which later became PPG Industries. The next 18 years are shown above and I am so proud of what I have achieved.

A passionate entrepreneur Andrew Hopkins is fast becoming one of the most recognized names in the automotive industry across the world.

As Executive Chairman of the Gemini Group, Andrew鈥檚 business interests facilitate a growing number of automotive repair businesses in the UK and feature the largest network of smash and mechanical facilities in Australia. 

In addition to the automotive profile, Andrew has built a solid property portfolio in the UK & Australia. The Aqua Resort being the latest acquisition, an exclusive beach side holiday retreat situated in Western Australia鈥檚 Margaret River region.

With over 50 repair centres globally and continuously investing in people and resources, Andrew has established an elite network of associates and partners allowing his companies to accelerate while maintaining outstanding quality and service.

People are the core of his business and Andrew is always taking extra steps to make sure staff are priority in his many companies. His passion for philanthropy and helping those in need has seen his business contribute towards various community and charity groups giving hope to those less fortunate.
